  2. Buttons

Pretty Button Complete

A ‘pretty’ buttons using guelph.ca styles, allows for different prefix icons using classes to identify button usages. A ‘Pretty Button’ should only be used on links (<a>) that require some extra flare. These include for example: links which direct the user to ‘learn more’, ‘provide feeedback’ or ‘apply’

  • Pretty Button - Default
  • Pretty Button - View
  • Pretty Button - Feedback
  • Pretty Button - Help
  • Pretty Button - Learn
  • Pretty Button - Report
  • Pretty Button - Pay
Pretty Button - Default prettybtn

A standard button using guelph.ca styles

Pretty Button - View prettybtn link-view

A button defining a link that the user will ‘view’

Pretty Button - Feedback prettybtn link-feedback

A button defining a link that the user will use to provide ‘feedback’

Pretty Button - Help prettybtn link-help

A button defining a link that the user will use to get ‘help’

Pretty Button - Learn prettybtn link-learn

A button defining a link that the user will use to ‘learn’

Pretty Button - Report prettybtn link-report

A button defining a link that the user will use to make a ‘report’

Pretty Button - Pay prettybtn link-pay

A button defining a link that the user will use to make a ‘payment’

    • HTML
    • HTML
    • HTML
    • HTML
    • HTML
    • HTML
    • HTML

Usage

Class Name Description
prettybtn

Apply to an <a> tag that you would like to become a pretty button. This will attach the baseline styles.
link-view

Add to the prettybtn element to add ‘view’ icon.
link-report

Add to the prettybtn element to add ‘report’ icon.
link-pay

Add to the prettybtn element to add ‘pay’ icon.
link-learn

Add to the prettybtn element to add ‘learn’ icon.
link-help

Add to the prettybtn element to add ‘help’ icon.
link-feedback

Add to the prettybtn element to add ‘feedback’ icon.
